6:
God rescues those who do what is right,
\q2 but those who do what is evil become slaves to their desires.
\q1
10:
When things go well for those who do what is right, those in their city are happy,
\q2 and shouts of joy are heard when wicked people die.
\q1
13:
Those who spread gossip tell secrets to others,
\q2 but a person you can trust will not talk about it.
\q1
15:
If you promise to pay off a loan that is taken by a stranger, you will lose your money.
\q2 You will be safe if you refuse to make any kind of agreement to pay someone else's debts.
\q1
17:
By their kindness to others kind people give good gifts to themselves,
\q2 but one who is cruel hurts himself by his cruelty. 
\q1
18:
Wicked people tell lies to make more money,
\q2 but those who do what is right will be paid even more because they earned it.
\q1
19:
Those who do what is right will live,
\q2 but those who do what is wrong will die.
\q1
20:
Yahweh hates those who take good things and they twist them and they do bad things with them, 
\q2 but he is delighted with those who always do what is right.
\q1
21:
It is certain that evil people will not escape their punishment.
\q2 and the children of those who do right will be kept safe. 
\q1
22:
If you see a gold ring in a pig's nose, 
\q2 that is very much like a beautiful woman who does not have good sense. 
\q1
23:
Those who do what is right desire things that result in good,
\q2 but the reward of the wicked is that they will experience Yahweh's wrath.
\q1
26:
People will curse the merchant who will not sell them grain,
\q2 but they praise the one who sells it.
\q1
27:
If you work hard and go out to find what is good, you will also find good will.
\q2 but if you look for evil, you will find it.
\q1
28:
Those who trust in their money will fall down,
\q2 but those who do what is right will grow like a healthy tree.
\q1
29:
Those who bring troubles to their families will inherit nothing,
\q2 and those who do foolish things will become the servants of those who are wise.
\q1
30:
Those who do what is right will be like a life giving tree, 
\q2 but acts of violence take away life.
\q1
31:
It is sure that those who do what is right will get what they truly deserve; 
\q2 but even more, the person who does bad things 
\q1 and the one who sins against Yahweh, 
\q1 will surely receive what they deserve.
